top_categories.workout_context: 750 miles. Your legs will beg to quit after 120. This trains the power output you need from mile 130 onward.
Atlas Mountain Race's Atlas Mountains, Ultra-endurance forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 750 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Atlas Mountain Race's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before February.
80,000ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
Every hard session works better with a bigger aerobic base. At 750 miles, base fitness is the difference between racing and surviving.
At Atlas Mountain Race, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
80,000ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
107ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
750 miles rewards fat oxidation. This volume work shifts your fuel mix so you're still burning fat at hour 5, not bonking at hour 3.
Endurance with intensity spikes baked in. Exactly what 80,000ft of climbing on atlas Mountains ultra-endurance gravel does to your power file on race day.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Atlas Mountain Race, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Atlas Mountain Race. Train it until it feels boring.

race_overlay.nutrition: Ultra-distance fueling for 750 miles: 80–100g carbs/hour from mile 1 — don’t wait until you’re hungry. Practice your exact race-day nutrition in every long training ride. Carry backup calories. 750 miles burns 8,000–12,000+ calories — you cannot replace them all, but you must try.
race_overlay.altitude: Atlas Mountain Race with 80,000ft of climbing, much of it above 8,000ft demands altitude preparation. Arrive 5–7 days early for acclimatization. Expect 5–15% power reduction at altitude. Increase iron intake 4 weeks out. Hydrate aggressively — altitude increases fluid loss by 20–40%.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at Atlas Mountain Race demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride atlas mountains ultra-endurance gravel at race-day cadence weekly. Expect: atlas mountains, ultra-endurance, self-supported. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 750 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, Gravel Specific, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 750 miles of atlas mountains ultra-endurance gravel in Morocco.
